content.question: Let <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region bounded by the graphs of <math alttext="y equals, one half times x squared, plus 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y equals, 2 plus 6 x, minus x squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>âˆ’</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in the figure above. What is the perimeter of region <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?
